oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibition buildings; Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Commemorations; Events; Fairs; Festivals
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Pythian Building, Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition. The building was situated on Lake Watauga. The picture shows a man rowing a gondola near a small bridge on the lake. Behind the Pythian Building can be seen the Parthenon and to either side large buildings which tend to dwarf the smaller building.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Calvert Bros. & Taylor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Pythian Building was erected by members of the order of the Knights of Pythias, a secret and fraternal order whose Nashville members erected the building as a resting place and social gathering to be used during the Centennial. The building was modeled after Monticello, the home of President Thomas Jefferson.
